Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2012 09:07AM jmf424 wrote: Binney, No I do not! I have looked into it and there are actually two in my area. I have been reading up on it and I thought it was supposed to be put on hold till the end!? So confused now! I get rads today at noon so will be asking for sure! My chest seems even harder this morning than when I went to bed and there are some very painful areas. Ugh! Trying to be positive.....thanks for your thoughts! :)
Posts.Title: Can you get Radiation twice? jmf424 CelineFlower

Posts.Content: jmf424 wrote: Hi all! Just looking for some thoughts! This is my 2nd dx of breast cancer, the 1st being 18 years ago at the age of 29. I had AC followed by Taxol for 12 weeks. The neuropathy seems to have gotten worse since! I had bilateral mastectomy in Sept and waited almost 2 weeks for pathology. I was totally shocked to find lymphovascular invasion and skin involvement!! So they want me to have radiation! I started last week...they are doing the entire chest wall in two separate fields and have me all marked up with sharpies. They won't let me wash it off or use lotion! I thought you shouldn't get radiation twice? And what about my skin? It is already swollen, bumpy, and hard with lymphadema! I am miserable with fear! Dx 10/1994, DCIS, 2cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/22 nodes, ER+/PR+ Surgery 11/3/1998 Lumpectomy: Right; Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary Chemotherapy 12/9/1998 CMF Radiation Therapy 5/6/1999 Breast Dx 4/2/2012, IDC, Right, 5cm, Stage IIIB, Grade 2, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 4/26/2012 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 9/13/2012 Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left Hormonal Therapy 9/27/2012 Aromasin (exemestane) Radiation Therapy 10/15/2012 Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Can you get Radiation twice? jmf424 CelineFlower
